model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I'm the boss!
Yeah, we know. You don't have to remind us every five minutes.
I just want everything to go smoothly and according to plan.
I understand that, but it doesn't always have to be your way or the highway.
Well, I just think that my way is usually the best way.
And sometimes it is, but we all have different ideas and perspectives to bring to the table.
Okay, I see your point. I'll try to be more open-minded in the future.
That's all we can ask for. Remember that we're a team and we all have something valuable to contribute.
You're right. I'm glad we can have these conversations and work towards being better together.
Me too. Speaking of working together, do you remember when you gave me back my watch a few months ago? That meant a lot to me.
Of course I remember! I'm happy we're friends again.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'Personal Interactions and Memories', 'Related Summaries': 'Co-workers A and Co-workers B share personal stories, memories, and moments of repairing friendships.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Co-workers A: Hey, check out what I bought today! ### Co-workers B: What did you get? ### Co-workers A: A baby doll and a rattle. They're so cute! ### Co-workers B: Are they for someone else or for you? ### Co-workers A: They're for me. I don't have any kids, but I thought it would be fun to have some toys around. ### Co-workers B: I see. Well, it's always good to have some toys to play with. ### Co-workers A: Yeah, and it reminds me of when I was a kid. I used to love playing with dolls and stuffed animals. ### Co-workers B: That's cute. Did you have a favorite toy? ### Co-workers A: I had this teddy bear that I got as a present from my grandma. I used to carry it around everywhere with me. ### Co-workers B: Aw, that's sweet. It's nice to have things like that to remember our childhood. ### Co-workers A: Definitely. Speaking of memories, do you remember when I gave you back your watch a few months ago? ### Co-workers B: Yeah, I do. I was so happy to have it back. ### Co-workers A: I was happy to give it back to you. It feels good to repair a friendship. ### Co-workers B: I agree. I'm glad we're still friends. ### Co-workers A: Me too. So, do you want to hear about my latest adventure with the baby doll?' }
```
